history.content:
TL; DR: Join us at Nvidia Tech Talk to learn about Nvidia ML and Hardware work, and potentially win the raffle for RTX 3090!!

Come and explore the future of computing in engaging talks by Nipun Agarwala (Senior ASIC Design Engineer) and Umur Darbaz (Senior GPU Architect). Learn how they are creating ML for HW and HW for ML and hear about some of the interesting challenges their teams are trying to solve at NVIDIA. We will be raffling off an NVIDIA RTX 3090 and more!
RSVP at: http://hkn.mu/nvidia
FB page: https://fb.me/e/2ZdWDAOLp
When: Monday, February 7th at 5PM PST
Location: https://berkeley.zoom.us/j/98968119511......
Who it’s for: UC Berkeley students, professors, and staff only
Learn more about our career opportunities by visiting www.nvidia.com/university.
-------------------------------------------------------------

About the Speakers:
- Nipun Agarwala, Senior ASIC Design Engineer
Nipun Agarwala is a Senior ASIC Design Engineering on NVIDIA’s GPU ASIC Design Team. He is responsible for driving the design of hardware, from architecture to the final netlist. He collaborates with the Architecture Team on future designs, develops micro-architecture, looks at PPA tradeoffs, and ensures hardware meets functional and physical requirements. Additionally, Nipun explores DL workloads, software programming models, and GPU applications to see how they impact future hardware design and architecture. Nipun received his B.S. and M.S. in Electrical Engineering from Stanford University
- Umur Darbaz, Senior GPU Architect
Umur Darbaz is a Senior GPU Architect at NVIDIA. He is responsible for developing new scheduling and work distribution features for the next generation of efficient, high-performance GPUs. Prior to working on the GPU Architecture Team, he was a Tegra System Architect at NVIDIA, developing autonomous systems. Umur holds B.S. and M.S. degrees in Computer Engineering from the University of Illinois at Urbana-Champaign.
